'Gwalior' () is a historical and major city in the Indian state of Madhya
Pradesh. It is located to the south of Agra, south of Delhi the capital city of
India, and north of Bhopal, the state capital. Gwalior occupies a strategic
location in the Gird region of India, and the city and its fortress have served
as the center of several of historic northern Indian kingdoms. It is famous for
Gwalior Fort, which has changed hands many times. From the Tomaras in the 8th
century, it passed to the Mughals, then the Marathas under the Scindias (1754).

Besides being the Administrative Headquarters of Gwalior district and Gwalior
division, Gwalior also hosts some administrative offices of Chambal Division.
Gwalior also hosts several Administrative Headquarters of the State as well the
Country; Few of them are The [http://causelists.nic.in/gwalior/index1.html High
Court of Madhya-Pradesh (Gwalior Bench)], Office of [http://cbn.nic.in/ The
Narcotics Commissioner of India (Central Bureau Of Narcotics)], Office of
[http://www.agmp.nic.in/ The Accountant-General (AG) of Madhya-Pradesh], Office
of [http://www.boardofrevenue.mp.gov.in/ The President-Board Of Revenue of Madhya-
Pradesh], Office of [http://www.mptransport.org/generalinformation.htm The Transport-
Commissioner of Madhya-Pradesh], Office of
[http://www.landrecords.mp.gov.in/index.htm The Commissioner-Land Records &
Settlements Madhya-Pradesh], Office of [http://www.mpexcise.org/contact.htm The
State Excise Commissioner of Madhya-Pradesh] etc. Gwalior also hosts Premiere
Government Institutions like Defense Research & Development Establishment(DRDE),
Country's only Border Security Force (BSF) Academy, National Cadet Corps (NCC)
[http://www.nccotagwalior.com/join_i/courses.htm Officer's Training
Academy](OTA). Gwalior also features a major Indian Air Force (IAF) Station, A
major Indian Army Cantonment (Morar Cantt.), Central Intelligence Bureau HO.
Numerous Colleges and Universities are located in Gwalior including
[http://www.nriitm.org/ NRIITM Gwalior], [http://www.iiitm.ac.in/ IIITM Gwalior]
& [http://www.iittm.org/ IITTM Gwalior].

Gwalior is surrounded by industrial and commercial zones of neighboring
districts (Malanpur - Bhind, Banmor - Morena) on all three main directions.
Gwalior is one of the largest city of Central India and is often referred to as
the tourist capital of the Madhya-Pradesh; The State being called as The Heart
Of Incredible India.


Gwalior Airport , also called Rajmata Vijya Raje Scindia Vimantal, is
the airport of Gwalior. It has an Indian Air Force Base which stations
Mirage fighters.
